    Calculate the necessary for one simulation.

    basic_simulation.Rd

    Calculate the necessary for one simulation.

    Usage

    basic_simulation(
  F_mat_W,
  L_mat_W,
  F_mat_Y,
  L_mat_Y,
  cov_mat_fs,
  cov_mat_rf,
  pi_unit,
  theta_w,
  theta_y,
  tau,
  no_noise,
  rho_agg,
  rho_cross,
  T_0,
  Z_fit,
  test = FALSE,
  S = 300
)

    Arguments

    F_mat_W

    a nxT two-way fixed effects matrix for W (endogenous treatment).

    L_mat_W

    a nxT generalized fixed effects (low-rank) matrix for W (endogenous treatment).

    F_mat_Y

    a nxT two-way fixed effects matrix for Y (outcome).

    L_mat_Y

    a nxT generalized fixed effects (low-rank) matrix for Y (outcome).

    cov_mat_fs

    a covarience matrix for W (endogenous treatment) noise.

    cov_mat_rf

    a covarience matrix for a part of Y (outcome) noise.

    pi_unit

    a nx1 vector of exposure.

    theta_w

    an exposure to unobserved confounder for W (endogenous treatment).

    theta_y

    an exposure to unobserved confounder for Y (outcome).

    tau

    the original point estimate of tau. It is used for data generation.

    no_noise

    If true, the noise is not added. We do not add noise for table 3.

    rho_agg

    the share of Z_t during H_t generation.

    rho_cross

    the share of W (endogenous treatment) noise in Y noise.

    T_0

    the size of the learning period.

    Z_fit

    the fitted ARIMA model to the data Z (instrument).

    test

    If true, compute the tests for the coverage rates.

    S

    if 'test' == TRUE, the number of simulations for standard error estimation.

    Value

    A list with simulation results.

    On this page
